h3.a: Laurel Area Community Foundation awards LCC $4,800 grant

div.p:
The Laurel Area Community Foundation recently awarded a $4,800 grant to LCC School to help defray costs associated with lunch delivery services provided during school closure due to the Covid-19 pandemic.
This is yet another example of the ongoing, generous support from our school communities!
We are all truly . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Laurel Area Community Foundation awards LCC $4,800 grant

h3.a: 2019-2020 End of School Year Important Dates

div.p:
Laurel-Concord-Coleridge School
End of School Year 2019-2020
Notice of Important Dates
LCC students will continue learning in at-home environments throughout the duration of school closure due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The following provides notice regarding important dates and year-end procedures.
May 7, 2020
Last day of home-based learning . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about 2019-2020 End of School Year Important Dates

div.p:
As we continue on into our alternate learning environment for the remainder of the school year, we have developed our Continuity of Learning Plan. This plan describes the temporary actions to support the continuation of teaching and learning for all students during the interruption of normal school attendance center operations.
Click here to download the Continuity of Learning plan for LCC.

a.aria-label: Read more about LCC's Continuity of Learning Plan

div.p:
LCC School Closure Lunch Orders
LCC School is offering a modified school lunch service to all interested families, regardless of income and at no cost, throughout the school closure period. Those eligible for meal service include all students enrolled at LCC School, as well as any children (ages 18 and younger) living in the household.
The meal service will begin on Monday, March . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about LCC School Closure Lunch Orders

div.p:
Public Notice
In accordance with the requirements of the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act of 2004 (IDEA 2004), the Laurel-Concord-Coleridge school district will host a meeting to discuss our plans for the provision of equitable special education services for students with disabilities parentally placed in a nonpublic school during the 2020-2021 school year. Parents of a . . .

As a result of the suspended spring sports season due to COVID-19, LCC is implementing the following lettering requirements for Girls and Boys Track & Field and Boys Golf during the 2019-20 school year.

div.em: Current conditions as of 29 Apr 07:35 am CDT

div.span: A 20 percent chance of showers after 3pm. Partly sunny, with a high near 63. Breezy, with a north northwest wind 21 to 23 mph, with gusts as high as 34 mph.
Mostly clear, with a low around 38. North northwest wind 12 to 17 mph decreasing to 5 to 10 mph in the evening. Winds could gust as high as 26 mph.
Sunny, with a high near 72. Light and variable wind becoming south southeast 5 to 8 mph in the morning.
